channel.title: Spring Framework on htr3n's
channel.link:
https://htr3n.github.io/tags/spring-framework/Recent content in Spring Framework on htr3n'sHugo -- gohugo.ioenThis work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.Wed, 21 Nov 2018 00:00:00 +0000
Spring Boot: Inversion-of-Control meets Convention-over-Configurationhttps://htr3n.github.io/2018/11/spring-boot-ioc-meets-coc/Wed, 21 Nov 2018 00:00:00 +0000https://htr3n.github.io/2018/11/spring-boot-ioc-meets-coc/I started using Spring framework back to 2009 or so to develop some demos for European projects. Most of these projects featured several Web services some share back-end databases, some interact with external services or WS-BPEL business processes, and so on.
Back to basics: Test-driven Spring JDBChttps://htr3n.github.io/2018/11/test-driven-spring-jdbc/Tue, 20 Nov 2018 00:00:00 +0000https://htr3n.github.io/2018/11/test-driven-spring-jdbc/Spring is a popular heavy-weight framework for developing Java/Groovy based applications. Its rich libraries and software stack can cover from front-end to back-end development. In 2009 I used Spring Framework 3 to develop web services and MVC+Hibernate portal for a fictious loan approval process.
A journey from Apache CXF 2.2 to 3.2https://htr3n.github.io/2018/06/apache-cxf-2-to-3/Fri, 15 Jun 2018 00:00:00 +0000https://htr3n.github.io/2018/06/apache-cxf-2-to-3/I have used Apache CXF 2.2 to develop Web services for some R&D projects that I took part in. At that time, it was a choice between Apache Axis/Axis2 and CXF (formerly Codehaus XFire project).
